intro: Diasperus flueggeiformis, commonly known as the Fluegge's rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, bright yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. The species is noted for its resilience and is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas.
